author: Cady Lang
title: Here‚Äôs How Celebrities Celebrated Super Bowl Sunday
text:
Whether you were rooting for the New England Patriots or the Atlanta Falcons during Super Bowl LI, or you were just there for the wings and Lady Gaga‚Äôs epic halftime performance , there was one thing that everyone could agree on and that‚Äôs that football is truly America‚Äôs favorite pasttime .
This year‚Äôs epic Super Bowl showdown brought out the fierce loyalties of Patriots and Falcons fans and celebrities were no exception. From Mark Wahlberg‚Äôs family affair to John Legend and Chrissy Teigen noshing on game day snacks, celebrities were more than ready to get down for the Super Bowl.

Thankfully for us, they thoughtfully documented it all on social media ‚Äî see the best celebrity Super Bowl celebrations below.
Ludacris and Andre 3000 couldn‚Äôt have been more excited for their beloved Falcons.
Stacks on Stacks on Stacks #riseup 
A photo posted by @ludacris on Feb 5, 2017 at 2:29pm PST 

Chrissy Teigen was more excited about the Super Bowl snacks than the game itself.
THINGS ARE HAPPENING pic.twitter.com/XCFaHBwV8C 
‚Äî christine teigen (@chrissyteigen) February 6, 2017 
Usher told fans that he had been waiting for the Falcons‚Äô moment since he was five years old.
. @Usher 's been waiting for this since he was 5 years old‚Ä¶
Almost time‚Ä¶ #SB51 pic.twitter.com/aBPpg5kWe7

Donatella Versace and her muse Lady Gaga hung out before the halftime show; Versace provided the wardrobe for Gaga‚Äôs epic performance.
Backstage with @ladygaga just before she hits the stage! #halftimeshow #SB51 #PepsiHalfTime 
A photo posted by Donatella Versace (@donatella_versace) on Feb 5, 2017 at 5:14pm PST 

2 Chainz and Usher hit up the sidelines before the game.
Great game @atlantafalcons me and my atown Patna @usher was there for the best game ever , hopefully next year 
A photo posted by 2 Chainz Aka Tity Boi (@hairweavekiller) on Feb 5, 2017 at 8:16pm PST 

Migos gave a motivational speech to the Falcons before the game.
. @Migos gives the @atlantafalcons a pregame speech for the ages pic.twitter.com/l6ERfMYB8E 
‚Äî Sports Illustrated (@SInow) February 5, 2017 
Chris Evans took to Twitter (and his caps lock) to share his excitement about the outcome of the game.
OH MY GOD GREATEST SPORTING EVENT OF MY ENTIRE LIFE!!!! CONGRATULATIONS NEW ENGLAD PATRIOTS!!!!
‚Äî Chris Evans (@ChrisEvans) February 6, 2017

Bom dia! Game day! #superbowl #daddyslittlegirl ‚ú®‚ù§Ô∏è‚ú®üèà

T.I., Young Jeezy, and Ludacris showed off their ATL pride in Houston.
Y'all forgive US‚Ä¶ We don't know how to act‚Ä¶ ain't never had SH*T!!!! BUT WE GON GET IT TODAY THO!!!! H #RISEUP #ATLFALCONS #SUPERBOWLLI 
A photo posted by TIP (@troubleman31) on Feb 5, 2017 at 6:03pm PST

It's almost game time. #SuperBowl

While Lady Gaga fully embraced the sports aspect by warming up in her own custom football gear.

atlanta

That comeback was crazier than a movie. Congrats to both teams on an amazing game. Unreal. #SuperBowl
